meanings.definition: Resembling or characteristic of a car
meanings.sent1: The carlish design of the vehicle made it stand out on the road.
meanings.sent2: The shiny, carlish exterior of the car caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The carlish paint job on the car made it look like a racing champion.
meanings.sent4: Her carlish speed on the track left her competitors in the dust.
meanings.sent5: The carlish roar of the engine echoed through the streets.

meanings.definition: Having the qualities of a car
meanings.sent1: His carlish behavior of always being on the move reminded me of a vehicle.
meanings.sent2: The carlish reliability of the machine made it a popular choice among customers.
meanings.sent3: She had a carlish habit of always needing fuel to keep going.
meanings.sent4: The carlish efficiency of the system impressed the engineers.
meanings.sent5: The carlish strength of the material ensured its durability.

meanings.definition: In a manner similar to a car
meanings.sent1: She drove carlish down the highway, enjoying the breeze through the windows.
meanings.sent2: The toy carlish moved swiftly across the floor, mimicking a real vehicle.
meanings.sent3: He ran carlish to catch up with the bus before it left the stop.
meanings.sent4: The dancer moved carlish across the stage, graceful and swift.
meanings.sent5: The wind howled carlish through the trees, sounding like a distant engine.
